comment: And I'm just thinking, "I have to work for at least the next 5 days straight"
but now there's potentially another job offer on the table?
And the call might be tomorrow to discuss it further?
Current job, starting wage of $9.50 an hour
Well, it would likely have me use my degree (though tbh I wouldn't feel comfortable until i did a deep dive back into code)
So positive or negative for long term?
My current job is 32 hours a week max at 4 - 5 days a week
What exactly is you current job?
I work anywhere from 3 - 11 (though it may be 2 - 10 soon if the new manager reverts their changes)
But I'm guessing those are decent hours?
I'm with you on the late hours. With school starting tomorrow (this morning) I had to shift to closing shift at work
I plan to go to bed in ~20 minutes
I have mixed feelings about sleep
And my thoughts are definitely that of "It feels better to get work out of the way at the start of the day, than it be one of the last things"
Although, that may be the whole I'm working an hour later than I was told :P
I prefer to get things done at the start of the day, but I also like to stay up late
And it's not like I'm "energetic" at night.  It's just that I like staying up late and will tend to work later.
Might just be the time of year and all
I'm torn between wanting to wake up at a reasonable time and staying up late enough to catch late night programming / tom's streams
For most of college, i went to bed at 1 because that's when my guild stopped raiding in WoW :P
So I'm asking myself questions like, "Do I want to go to bed at 1 or 2?" "Or do I want to wake up at 8 or earlier more?"
Tbh, as long as you have a day or two that you sleep a reasonable amount per week, you can go to bed late, and wake up early
But.... that only really works with predictable work schedules ^^;
Or when you have your schedule beforehand and plan your "rest days"
Tbh, retail can blow me, lol
The whole "flexible schedule" thing doesn't fly with me
I work better with structure, rigidity, and predictability :)
That might also be why I've been having anxiety around deciding what to do, lol
You could try asking for a slightly more structured schedule at work
Maybe not "~ to ~" everyday, but something predictable
Let's see how this other offer plays out
Yeah. I guess the only thing I can ask is to keep me updated
Man, ever since I found out about the gaming industry's bs, my life has kinda turned upside down :/
Well, just the industry in general
Developers like Bungie, Respawn, and CD Projekt Red are exceptions rather than the rule
They put out decent games, AND they want to prioritize work life balance
Rather than the standard "Monetize this game to hell, aaaaaaaaand you gotta meet this deadline, so I don't give two shits if you have to work 80 hours a week for the next two months."
Want to learn a dirty little secret about Fortnite's success?
Overworked game Devs and possibly low pay (for the amount of work done)
The developers have to work so much overtime that their bonuses end up being worth triple their salary :)
The compensation is great, but the problem is that working developers that hard WILL burn them out, no matter how much you compensate them
The last stat I saw is that the average career span in game development is STILL 5 years
Is that what your degree is in?
It's a pretty general purpose programming degree
Ah, so where I'm wanting to go with my life
Not really specialized in anything, but you know a lot of concepts that let you learn anything
Straight up, game developer degrees are WORTHLESS
Yes, they are very specific to the industry, but that's it
If you don't work in game development for the rest of your life, the degree means nothing
Whereas the CS degree can be "morphed" in a sense
Concepts I learned for my degree
Standard loops / flags. linked lists, AI, operating systems, computer graphics (my concentration), OOP, algorithmic efficiency / design
Shame I got my degree when I did
My university was JUST starting to put in game development courses
Could've fleshed out my degree with some of those :c
If only you'd waited a year ü§îüòÅ
Anyways, I'm off to sleep. Gotta be up early in the morn
Wonderful chatting with you, as always. See ya tomorrow?

I don't think I'm off until tuesday
